column2: OREGON DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
2. This sign tells drivers that:
column8: left and right turns are not allowed.
column10: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 4. If you provide false information on your DMV application, you may face:
column8: A one-year suspension of your driving privileges.

column2: 5. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 6. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
7. Your BAC depends on:
column8: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 8. Alcohol:
column4: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column6: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column10: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 9. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
10. This sign means:
column6: You must yield the right-of-way ahead

column2: 11. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column8: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column2: 12. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 13. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column8: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column10: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.

column2: 14. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column6: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column8: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column6: You may proceed only if the way is clear
column8: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way

column2: 16. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: show which lanes you must use.
column8: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 17. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
18. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
19. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: gives you time to react to situations.
column6: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.

column2: 20. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 21. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.

column2: 22. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 23. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column6: watch for children walking along the side of the road.

column2: 24. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05
column8: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column10: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit

column2: 25. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column8: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column10: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 26. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 27. BAC is:
column4: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column10: the amount of alcohol in your body.

column2: 28. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column8: use only one hand on the wheel.
column10: not check behind you through your mirrors.

column2: 29. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
30. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
